title: Creating a homely atmosphere
creator_contributor_role: Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Mentally handicapped
description: Designed to introduce the intellectual disability residential care worker to some simple ways of creating a homelike environment in the physical sense with furnishing and decor, how to create a desirable psychological atmosphere through community involvement and high quality staff-resident, staff-staff and resident-resident interactions, an interpretation of the term "normalisation" and how this principle might be applied in a residential setting and the recognition of the individual resident's rights in what is their home. Accompanied by 32p. in-service training manual.
